fotoshop

Class Editor

  • java.lang.Object
    • fotoshop.Editor

  • public class Editor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the main processing class of the Fotoshop application. Fotoshop is a very simple image editing tool. Users can apply a number of filters to an image. That's all. It should really be extended to make it more useful! To edit an image, create an instance of this class and call the "edit" method. This main class creates and initialises all the others: it creates the UI and interacts with it.
    Version:
    2013.09.10
    Author:
    Richard Jones

    • Method Detail

      • edit

        public void edit()
        Main edit routine. Loops until the end of the editing session.

      • getImageName

        public java.lang.String getImageName()
        Returns:
        the name of the current image, null if there is no current image

      • getFilters

        public Filter[] getFilters()
        Returns:
        an array containing the filters applied to the current image, an empty array if there is no current image.

      • loadImage

        public void loadImage(java.lang.String name)
        Load an image from a file and handle a possible error.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the image file

      • saveImage

        public void saveImage(java.lang.String outputName)
        Save an image to a file and handle a possible error
        Parameters:
        outputName - The name of the new image file

      • mono

        public boolean mono()
        Convert the current image to monochrome.
        Returns:
        false if no current image

      • rot90

        public boolean rot90()
        Rotate the current image 90 degrees.
        Returns:
        false if no current image

      • runScript

        public boolean runScript(java.lang.String scriptName)
        The 'script' command runs a sequence of commands from a text file. IT IS IMPORTANT THAT THIS COMMAND WORKS AS IT CAN BE USED FOR TESTING
        Parameters:
        command - the name of the script file.
        Returns:
        whether to quit.

      • putImage

        public void putImage(java.lang.String name)
        Add a copy of the current image to the cache as name.
        Parameters:
        name - a name of the image being store

      • get

        public void get(java.lang.String name)
        Replace the current image with a copy of the image named name from the cache.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the image to retrieve

      • getCacheNames

        public java.lang.String[] getCacheNames()
        Returns:
        an array containing the names of all the images of the cache

      • undo

        public boolean undo()
        Remove the last filter (where applicable) from the current image
        Returns:
        true if succeeded
